1: Hear this word that Yahweh has spoken against you, people of Israel, against the whole family that I brought up out of the land of Egypt:\q
2:
"I have chosen only you\q from all the families of the earth.
\q Therefore I will punish you
\q for all your sins."


\q
3:
Will two walk together\q unless they have agreed?
\q
4:
Will a lion roar in the forest\q when he has no victim?
\q Will a young lion growl from his den
\q if he has caught nothing?


\q
5:
Can a bird fall in a trap on the ground\q when no bait is set for him?
\q Will a trap spring up from the ground
\q when it has not caught anything?
\q
6:
If a trumpet sounds in a city,\q will the people not tremble?
\q If disaster overtakes a city,
\q has Yahweh not sent it?


\q
7:
Surely the Lord Yahweh will do nothing\q unless he reveals his plan to his servants the prophets.
\q
8:
The lion has roared;\q who will not fear?
\q The Lord Yahweh has spoken;
\q who will not prophesy?


\q
9:
Proclaim this in the fortresses at Ashdod,\q and in the fortresses in the land of Egypt;
\q say, "Assemble yourselves on the mountains of Samaria
\q and see what great confusion is in her,
\q and what oppression is in her.
\q
10:
For they do not know how to do right\q —this is Yahweh's declaration—
\q They store up violence
\q and destruction in their fortresses."


\q
11:
Therefore, this is what the Lord Yahweh says:\q "An enemy will surround the land,
\q and pull down your strongholds
\q and plunder your fortresses."
\q
13:
Hear and testify\q against the house of Jacob
\q —this is the declaration of the Lord Yahweh, the God of hosts:
\q
14:
"For in the day that I punish the sins of Israel,\q I will also punish the altars of Bethel.
\q The horns of the altar will be cut off
\q and fall to the ground.


\q
15:
I will destroy the winter house\q with the summer house.
\q The houses of ivory will perish,
\q and the large houses will vanish,
\q —this is Yahweh's declaration."
